definitions: In regular expressions, this syntax typically refers to the starting position of a match within a string, often used to initialize or update a variable named 'current' with that starting index.
examples: After finding the first occurrence, current = re.start; was used to mark the beginning of the next search.
The script set current = re.start; to keep track of where the pattern was found.
To process the string segment by segment, current = re.start; was crucial for iteration.
transcript: ˈkʌrənt ɪkwəlz ˌɑːr iː dɑːt stɑːrt
